class_description:
When you create a slice of a string, a Substring instance is the result. Operating on substrings is fast and efficient because a substring shares its storage with the original string. The Substring type presents the same interface as String, so you can avoid or defer any copying of the string’s contents.
The following example creates a greeting string, and then finds the substring of the first sentence:
You can perform many string operations on a substring. Here, we find the length of the first sentence and create an uppercase version.
This example defines a rawData string with some unstructured data, and then uses the string’s prefix(while:) method to create a substring of the numeric prefix:
When you need to store a substring or pass it to a function that requires a String instance, you can convert it to a String by using the String(_:) initializer. Calling this initializer copies the contents of the substring to a new string.
Alternatively, you can convert the function that takes a String to one that is generic over the StringProtocol protocol. The following code declares a generic version of the parseAndAddOne(_:) function:
You can call this generic function with an instance of either String or Substring.
Important
Don’t store substrings longer than you need them to perform a specific operation. A substring holds a reference to the entire storage of the string it comes from, not just to the portion it presents, even when there is no other reference to the original string. Storing substrings may, therefore, prolong the lifetime of string data that is no longer otherwise accessible, which can appear to be memory leakage.

Methods.method_description: Creates an empty substring.
Methods.method_declar: init()
init(_ content: String)
init<S>(_ elements: S) where S : Sequence, S.Element == Character

Methods.method_description: Creates a new instance of a collection containing the elements of a sequence.

params.param_description: The sequence of elements for the new collection.

Methods.method_declar: init<S>(_ elements: S) where S : Sequence, Self.Element == S.Element

Methods.method_description: Creates a Substring having the given content.
Methods.method_declar: init(_ content: Substring.UnicodeScalarView)

Methods.method_description: Creates a Substring having the given content.
Methods.method_declar: init(_ content: Substring.UTF8View)

Methods.method_description: Creates a Substring having the given content.
Methods.method_declar: init(_ content: Substring.UTF16View)

Methods.method_description: Creates a string from the null-terminated, UTF-8 encoded sequence of bytes at the given pointer.

params.param_description: A pointer to a sequence of contiguous, UTF-8 encoded bytes ending just before the first zero byte.

Methods.method_declar: init(cString nullTerminatedUTF8: UnsafePointer<CChar>)

Methods.method_description: Creates a string from the given Unicode code units in the specified encoding.

params.param_description: A collection of code units encoded in the encoding specified in sourceEncoding.
The encoding in which codeUnits should be interpreted.

Methods.method_declar: init<C, Encoding>(decoding codeUnits: C, as sourceEncoding: Encoding.Type) where C : Collection, Encoding : _UnicodeEncoding, C.Element == Encoding.CodeUnit

Methods.method_description: Creates a string from the null-terminated sequence of bytes at the given pointer.

params.param_description: A pointer to a sequence of contiguous code units in the encoding specified in sourceEncoding, ending just before the first zero code unit.
The encoding in which the code units should be interpreted.

Methods.method_declar: init<Encoding>(decodingCString nullTerminatedCodeUnits: UnsafePointer<Encoding.CodeUnit>, as sourceEncoding: Encoding.Type) where Encoding : _UnicodeEncoding
init(extendedGraphemeClusterLiteral value: String)
init(extendedGraphemeClusterLiteral value: String)

Methods.method_description: Creates a new collection containing the specified number of a single, repeated value.

params.param_description: The element to repeat.
The number of times to repeat the value passed in the repeating parameter. count must be zero or greater.

Methods.method_declar: init(repeating repeatedValue: Character, count: Int)
init(stringLiteral value: String)
init(unicodeScalarLiteral value: String)
init(unicodeScalarLiteral value: String)

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether every element of a sequence satisfies a given predicate.

params.param_description: A closure that takes an element of the sequence as its argument and returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the passed element satisfies a condition.

Methods.method_declar: func allSatisfy(_ predicate: (Character) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Bool

return_description: true if the sequence contains only elements that satisfy predicate; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_declar: mutating func append<S>(contentsOf elements: S) where S : Sequence, S.Element == Character

Methods.method_description: Returns an array containing the non-nil results of calling the given transformation with each element of this sequence.

params.param_description: A closure that accepts an element of this sequence as its argument and returns an optional value.

Methods.method_declar: func compactMap<ElementOfResult>(_ transform: (Character) throws -> ElementOfResult?) rethrows -> [ElementOfResult]

return_description: An array of the non-nil results of calling transform with each element of the sequence.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the sequence contains the given element.

params.param_description: The element to find in the sequence.

Methods.method_declar: func contains(_ element: Character) -> Bool

return_description: true if the element was found in the sequence; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the sequence contains an element that satisfies the given predicate.

params.param_description: A closure that takes an element of the sequence as its argument and returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the passed element represents a match.

Methods.method_declar: func contains(where predicate: (Character) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Bool

return_description: true if the sequence contains an element that satisfies predicate; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_declar: func distance(from start: Substring.Index, to end: Substring.Index) -> Int

Methods.method_description: Returns a subsequence by skipping elements while predicate returns true and returning the remaining elements.

params.param_description: A closure that takes an element of the sequence as its argument and returns true if the element should be skipped or false if it should be included. Once the predicate returns false it will not be called again.

Methods.method_declar: func drop(while predicate: (Character) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Substring

Methods.method_description: Returns a subsequence containing all but the given number of initial elements.

params.param_description: The number of elements to drop from the beginning of the collection. k must be greater than or equal to zero.

Methods.method_declar: func dropFirst(_ k: Int = 1) -> Substring

return_description: A subsequence starting after the specified number of elements.

Methods.method_description: Returns a subsequence containing all but the specified number of final elements.

params.param_description: The number of elements to drop off the end of the collection. k must be greater than or equal to zero.

Methods.method_declar: func dropLast(_ k: Int) -> Substring

return_description: A subsequence that leaves off k elements from the end.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this sequence and another sequence contain the same elements in the same order.

params.param_description: A sequence to compare to this sequence.

Methods.method_declar: func elementsEqual<OtherSequence>(_ other: OtherSequence) -> Bool where OtherSequence : Sequence, Self.Element == OtherSequence.Element

return_description: true if this sequence and other contain the same elements in the same order.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this sequence and another sequence contain equivalent elements in the same order, using the given predicate as the equivalence test.

params.param_description: A sequence to compare to this sequence.
A predicate that returns true if its two arguments are equivalent; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_declar: func elementsEqual<OtherSequence>(_ other: OtherSequence, by areEquivalent: (Character, OtherSequence.Element) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Bool where OtherSequence : Sequence

return_description: true if this sequence and other contain equivalent items, using areEquivalent as the equivalence test; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_description: Returns a sequence of pairs (n, x), where n represents a consecutive integer starting at zero and x represents an element of the sequence.
Methods.method_declar: func enumerated() -> EnumeratedSequence<Substring>

return_description: A sequence of pairs enumerating the sequence.

Methods.method_declar: func filter(_ isIncluded: (Substring.Element) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> String

Methods.method_description: Returns the first element of the sequence that satisfies the given predicate.

params.param_description: A closure that takes an element of the sequence as its argument and returns a Boolean value indicating whether the element is a match.

Methods.method_declar: func first(where predicate: (Character) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Character?

return_description: The first element of the sequence that satisfies predicate, or nil if there is no element that satisfies predicate.

Methods.method_description: Returns the first index where the specified value appears in the collection.

params.param_description: An element to search for in the collection.

Methods.method_declar: func firstIndex(of element: Character) -> String.Index?

return_description: The first index where element is found. If element is not found in the collection, returns nil.

Methods.method_description: Returns the first index in which an element of the collection satisfies the given predicate.

params.param_description: A closure that takes an element as its argument and returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the passed element represents a match.

Methods.method_declar: func firstIndex(where predicate: (Character) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> String.Index?

return_description: The index of the first element for which predicate returns true. If no elements in the collection satisfy the given predicate, returns nil.

Methods.method_description: Calls the given closure on each element in the sequence in the same order as a for-in loop.

params.param_description: A closure that takes an element of the sequence as a parameter.

Methods.method_declar: func forEach(_ body: (Character) throws -> Void) rethrows

Methods.method_description: Offsets the given index by the specified distance.

params.param_description: A valid index of the collection.
The distance to offset i. distance must not be negative unless the collection conforms to the BidirectionalCollection protocol.

Methods.method_declar: func formIndex(_ i: inout String.Index, offsetBy distance: Int)

Methods.method_description: Offsets the given index by the specified distance, or so that it equals the given limiting index.

params.param_description: A valid index of the collection.
The distance to offset i. distance must not be negative unless the collection conforms to the BidirectionalCollection protocol.
A valid index of the collection to use as a limit. If distance > 0, a limit that is less than i has no effect. Likewise, if distance < 0, a limit that is greater than i has no effect.

Methods.method_declar: func formIndex(_ i: inout String.Index, offsetBy distance: Int, limitedBy limit: String.Index) -> Bool

return_description: true if i has been offset by exactly distance steps without going beyond limit; otherwise, false. When the return value is false, the value of i is equal to limit.

Methods.method_description: Replaces the given index with its successor.

params.param_description: A valid index of the collection. i must be less than endIndex.

Methods.method_declar: func formIndex(after i: inout String.Index)

Methods.method_description: Replaces the given index with its predecessor.

params.param_description: A valid index of the collection. i must be greater than startIndex.

Methods.method_declar: func formIndex(before i: inout String.Index)

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the string begins with the specified prefix.

params.param_description: A possible prefix to test against this string.

Methods.method_declar: func hasPrefix<Prefix>(_ prefix: Prefix) -> Bool where Prefix : StringProtocol

return_description: true if the string begins with prefix; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the string ends with the specified suffix.

params.param_description: A possible suffix to test against this string.

Methods.method_declar: func hasSuffix<Suffix>(_ suffix: Suffix) -> Bool where Suffix : StringProtocol

return_description: true if the string ends with suffix; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_description: Hashes the essential components of this value by feeding them into the given hasher.

params.param_description: The hasher to use when combining the components of this instance.

Methods.method_declar: func hash(into hasher: inout Hasher)
func index(_ i: Substring.Index, offsetBy n: Int) -> Substring.Index
func index(_ i: Substring.Index, offsetBy n: Int, limitedBy limit: Substring.Index) -> Substring.Index?
func index(after i: Substring.Index) -> Substring.Index
func index(before i: Substring.Index) -> Substring.Index

Methods.method_description: Returns the last element of the sequence that satisfies the given predicate.

params.param_description: A closure that takes an element of the sequence as its argument and returns a Boolean value indicating whether the element is a match.

Methods.method_declar: func last(where predicate: (Character) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Character?

return_description: The last element of the sequence that satisfies predicate, or nil if there is no element that satisfies predicate.

Methods.method_description: Returns the last index where the specified value appears in the collection.

params.param_description: An element to search for in the collection.

Methods.method_declar: func lastIndex(of element: Character) -> String.Index?

return_description: The last index where element is found. If element is not found in the collection, this method returns nil.

Methods.method_description: Returns the index of the last element in the collection that matches the given predicate.

params.param_description: A closure that takes an element as its argument and returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the passed element represents a match.

Methods.method_declar: func lastIndex(where predicate: (Character) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> String.Index?

return_description: The index of the last element in the collection that matches predicate, or nil if no elements match.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the sequence precedes another sequence in a lexicographical (dictionary) ordering, using the less-than operator (<) to compare elements.

params.param_description: A sequence to compare to this sequence.

Methods.method_declar: func lexicographicallyPrecedes<OtherSequence>(_ other: OtherSequence) -> Bool where OtherSequence : Sequence, Self.Element == OtherSequence.Element

return_description: true if this sequence precedes other in a dictionary ordering; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the sequence precedes another sequence in a lexicographical (dictionary) ordering, using the given predicate to compare elements.

params.param_description: A sequence to compare to this sequence.
A predicate that returns true if its first argument should be ordered before its second argument; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_declar: func lexicographicallyPrecedes<OtherSequence>(_ other: OtherSequence, by areInIncreasingOrder: (Character, Character) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Bool where OtherSequence : Sequence, Self.Element == OtherSequence.Element

return_description: true if this sequence precedes other in a dictionary ordering as ordered by areInIncreasingOrder; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_declar: func lowercased() -> String

Methods.method_description: Returns an iterator over the elements of the collection.
Methods.method_declar: func makeIterator() -> IndexingIterator<Substring>

Methods.method_description: Returns an array containing the results of mapping the given closure over the sequence’s elements.

params.param_description: A mapping closure. transform accepts an element of this sequence as its parameter and returns a transformed value of the same or of a different type.

Methods.method_declar: func map<T>(_ transform: (Character) throws -> T) rethrows -> [T]

return_description: An array containing the transformed elements of this sequence.

Methods.method_description: Returns an array containing the results of mapping the given closure over the sequence’s elements.

params.param_description: A mapping closure. transform accepts an element of this sequence as its parameter and returns a transformed value of the same or of a different type.

Methods.method_declar: func map<T>(_ transform: (Character) throws -> T) rethrows -> [T]

return_description: An array containing the transformed elements of this sequence.

Methods.method_description: Returns the maximum element in the sequence.
Methods.method_declar: @warn_unqualified_access func max() -> Character?

return_description: The sequence’s maximum element. If the sequence has no elements, returns nil.

Methods.method_description: Returns the maximum element in the sequence, using the given predicate as the comparison between elements.

params.param_description: A predicate that returns true if its first argument should be ordered before its second argument; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_declar: @warn_unqualified_access func max(by areInIncreasingOrder: (Character, Character) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Character?

return_description: The sequence’s maximum element if the sequence is not empty; otherwise, nil.

Methods.method_description: Returns the minimum element in the sequence.
Methods.method_declar: @warn_unqualified_access func min() -> Character?

return_description: The sequence’s minimum element. If the sequence has no elements, returns nil.

Methods.method_description: Returns the minimum element in the sequence, using the given predicate as the comparison between elements.

params.param_description: A predicate that returns true if its first argument should be ordered before its second argument; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_declar: @warn_unqualified_access func min(by areInIncreasingOrder: (Character, Character) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Character?

return_description: The sequence’s minimum element, according to areInIncreasingOrder. If the sequence has no elements, returns nil.

Methods.method_description: Removes and returns the first element of the collection.
Methods.method_declar: mutating func popFirst() -> Character?

return_description: The first element of the collection if the collection is not empty; otherwise, nil.

Methods.method_description: Removes and returns the last element of the collection.
Methods.method_declar: mutating func popLast() -> Character?

return_description: The last element of the collection if the collection is not empty; otherwise, nil.

Methods.method_description: Removes and returns the last element of the collection.
Methods.method_declar: mutating func popLast() -> Character?

return_description: The last element of the collection if the collection is not empty; otherwise, nil.

Methods.method_description: Returns a subsequence, up to the specified maximum length, containing the initial elements of the collection.

params.param_description: The maximum number of elements to return. maxLength must be greater than or equal to zero.

Methods.method_declar: func prefix(_ maxLength: Int) -> Substring

return_description: A subsequence starting at the beginning of this collection with at most maxLength elements.

Methods.method_description: Returns a subsequence from the start of the collection through the specified position.
Methods.method_declar: func prefix(through position: String.Index) -> Substring

return_description: A subsequence up to, and including, the end position.

Methods.method_description: Returns a subsequence from the start of the collection up to, but not including, the specified position.

params.param_description: The “past the end” index of the resulting subsequence. end must be a valid index of the collection.

Methods.method_declar: func prefix(upTo end: String.Index) -> Substring

return_description: A subsequence up to, but not including, the end position.

Methods.method_description: Returns a subsequence containing the initial elements until predicate returns false and skipping the remaining elements.

params.param_description: A closure that takes an element of the sequence as its argument and returns true if the element should be included or false if it should be excluded. Once the predicate returns false it will not be called again.

Methods.method_declar: func prefix(while predicate: (Character) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Substring

Methods.method_description: Returns a random element of the collection.
Methods.method_declar: func randomElement() -> Character?

return_description: A random element from the collection. If the collection is empty, the method returns nil.

Methods.method_description: Returns a random element of the collection, using the given generator as a source for randomness.

params.param_description: The random number generator to use when choosing a random element.

Methods.method_declar: func randomElement<T>(using generator: inout T) -> Character? where T : RandomNumberGenerator

return_description: A random element from the collection. If the collection is empty, the method returns nil.

Methods.method_description: Returns the result of combining the elements of the sequence using the given closure.

params.param_description: The value to use as the initial accumulating value. initialResult is passed to nextPartialResult the first time the closure is executed.
A closure that combines an accumulating value and an element of the sequence into a new accumulating value, to be used in the next call of the nextPartialResult closure or returned to the caller.

Methods.method_declar: func reduce<Result>(_ initialResult: Result, _ nextPartialResult: (Result, Character) throws -> Result) rethrows -> Result

return_description: The final accumulated value. If the sequence has no elements, the result is initialResult.

Methods.method_description: Removes and returns the element at the specified position.

params.param_description: The position of the element to remove. position must be a valid index of the collection that is not equal to the collection’s end index.

Methods.method_declar: @discardableResult mutating func remove(at position: String.Index) -> Character

return_description: The removed element.

Methods.method_description: Removes all elements from the collection.

params.param_description: Pass true to request that the collection avoid releasing its storage. Retaining the collection’s storage can be a useful optimization when you’re planning to grow the collection again. The default value is false.

Methods.method_declar: mutating func removeAll(keepingCapacity keepCapacity: Bool = false)

Methods.method_description: Removes all the elements that satisfy the given predicate.

params.param_description: A closure that takes an element of the sequence as its argument and returns a Boolean value indicating whether the element should be removed from the collection.

Methods.method_declar: mutating func removeAll(where shouldBeRemoved: (Character) throws -> Bool) rethrows

Methods.method_description: Removes and returns the first element of the collection.
Methods.method_declar: @discardableResult mutating func removeFirst() -> Character

return_description: The removed element.

Methods.method_description: Removes and returns the first element of the collection.
Methods.method_declar: @discardableResult mutating func removeFirst() -> Character

return_description: The removed element.

Methods.method_description: Removes and returns the first element of the collection.
Methods.method_declar: @discardableResult mutating func removeFirst() -> Character

return_description: The removed element.

Methods.method_description: Removes the specified number of elements from the beginning of the collection.

params.param_description: The number of elements to remove from the collection. k must be greater than or equal to zero and must not exceed the number of elements in the collection.

Methods.method_declar: mutating func removeFirst(_ k: Int)

Methods.method_description: Removes the specified number of elements from the beginning of the collection.

params.param_description: The number of elements to remove from the collection. k must be greater than or equal to zero and must not exceed the number of elements in the collection.

Methods.method_declar: mutating func removeFirst(_ k: Int)

Methods.method_description: Removes the specified number of elements from the beginning of the collection.

params.param_description: The number of elements to remove from the collection. k must be greater than or equal to zero and must not exceed the number of elements in the collection.

Methods.method_declar: mutating func removeFirst(_ k: Int)

Methods.method_description: Removes and returns the last element of the collection.
Methods.method_declar: @discardableResult mutating func removeLast() -> Character

return_description: The last element of the collection.

Methods.method_description: Removes and returns the last element of the collection.
Methods.method_declar: @discardableResult mutating func removeLast() -> Character

return_description: The last element of the collection.

Methods.method_description: Removes the specified number of elements from the end of the collection.

params.param_description: The number of elements to remove from the collection. k must be greater than or equal to zero and must not exceed the number of elements in the collection.

Methods.method_declar: mutating func removeLast(_ k: Int)

Methods.method_description: Removes the specified number of elements from the end of the collection.

params.param_description: The number of elements to remove from the collection. k must be greater than or equal to zero and must not exceed the number of elements in the collection.

Methods.method_declar: mutating func removeLast(_ k: Int)

Methods.method_description: Removes the elements in the specified subrange from the collection.

params.param_description: The range of the collection to be removed. The bounds of the range must be valid indices of the collection.

Methods.method_declar: mutating func removeSubrange(_ bounds: Range<String.Index>)

Methods.method_description: Removes the elements in the specified subrange from the collection.

params.param_description: The range of the collection to be removed. The bounds of the range must be valid indices of the collection.

Methods.method_declar: mutating func removeSubrange<R>(_ bounds: R) where R : RangeExpression, Self.Index == R.Bound
mutating func replaceSubrange(_ bounds: Range<Substring.Index>, with newElements: Substring)
mutating func replaceSubrange<C>(_ bounds: Range<Substring.Index>, with newElements: C) where C : Collection, C.Element == Substring.Iterator.Element

Methods.method_description: Prepares the collection to store the specified number of elements, when doing so is appropriate for the underlying type.

params.param_description: The requested number of elements to store.

Methods.method_declar: mutating func reserveCapacity(_ n: Int)

Methods.method_description: Returns a view presenting the elements of the collection in reverse order.
Methods.method_declar: func reversed() -> ReversedCollection<Substring>

Methods.method_description: Returns the elements of the sequence, shuffled.
Methods.method_declar: func shuffled() -> [Character]

return_description: A shuffled array of this sequence’s elements.

Methods.method_description: Returns the elements of the sequence, shuffled using the given generator as a source for randomness.

params.param_description: The random number generator to use when shuffling the sequence.

Methods.method_declar: func shuffled<T>(using generator: inout T) -> [Character] where T : RandomNumberGenerator

return_description: An array of this sequence’s elements in a shuffled order.

Methods.method_description: Returns the elements of the sequence, sorted.
Methods.method_declar: func sorted() -> [Character]

return_description: A sorted array of the sequence’s elements.

Methods.method_description: Returns the elements of the sequence, sorted using the given predicate as the comparison between elements.

params.param_description: A predicate that returns true if its first argument should be ordered before its second argument; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_declar: func sorted(by areInIncreasingOrder: (Character, Character) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> [Character]

return_description: A sorted array of the sequence’s elements.

Methods.method_description: Returns the longest possible subsequences of the collection, in order, that don’t contain elements satisfying the given predicate.

params.param_description: The maximum number of times to split the collection, or one less than the number of subsequences to return. If maxSplits + 1 subsequences are returned, the last one is a suffix of the original collection containing the remaining elements. maxSplits must be greater than or equal to zero. The default value is Int.max.

If false, an empty subsequence is returned in the result for each pair of consecutive elements satisfying the isSeparator predicate and for each element at the start or end of the collection satisfying the isSeparator predicate. The default value is true.
A closure that takes an element as an argument and returns a Boolean value indicating whether the collection should be split at that element.

Methods.method_declar: func split(maxSplits: Int = Int.max, omittingEmptySubsequences: Bool = true, whereSeparator isSeparator: (Character) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> [Substring]

return_description: An array of subsequences, split from this collection’s elements.

Methods.method_description: Returns the longest possible subsequences of the collection, in order, around elements equal to the given element.

params.param_description: The element that should be split upon.

The maximum number of times to split the collection, or one less than the number of subsequences to return. If maxSplits + 1 subsequences are returned, the last one is a suffix of the original collection containing the remaining elements. maxSplits must be greater than or equal to zero. The default value is Int.max.

If false, an empty subsequence is returned in the result for each consecutive pair of separator elements in the collection and for each instance of separator at the start or end of the collection. If true, only nonempty subsequences are returned. The default value is true.

Methods.method_declar: func split(separator: Character, maxSplits: Int = Int.max, omittingEmptySubsequences: Bool = true) -> [Substring]

return_description: An array of subsequences, split from this collection’s elements.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the initial elements of the sequence are the same as the elements in another sequence.

params.param_description: A sequence to compare to this sequence.

Methods.method_declar: func starts<PossiblePrefix>(with possiblePrefix: PossiblePrefix) -> Bool where PossiblePrefix : Sequence, Self.Element == PossiblePrefix.Element

return_description: true if the initial elements of the sequence are the same as the elements of possiblePrefix; otherwise, false. If possiblePrefix has no elements, the return value is true.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the initial elements of the sequence are equivalent to the elements in another sequence, using the given predicate as the equivalence test.

params.param_description: A sequence to compare to this sequence.
A predicate that returns true if its two arguments are equivalent; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_declar: func starts<PossiblePrefix>(with possiblePrefix: PossiblePrefix, by areEquivalent: (Character, PossiblePrefix.Element) throws -> Bool) rethrows -> Bool where PossiblePrefix : Sequence

return_description: true if the initial elements of the sequence are equivalent to the elements of possiblePrefix; otherwise, false. If possiblePrefix has no elements, the return value is true.

Methods.method_description: Returns a subsequence, up to the given maximum length, containing the final elements of the collection.

params.param_description: The maximum number of elements to return. maxLength must be greater than or equal to zero.

Methods.method_declar: func suffix(_ maxLength: Int) -> Substring

return_description: A subsequence terminating at the end of the collection with at most maxLength elements.

Methods.method_description: Returns a subsequence from the specified position to the end of the collection.

params.param_description: The index at which to start the resulting subsequence. start must be a valid index of the collection.

Methods.method_declar: func suffix(from start: String.Index) -> Substring

return_description: A subsequence starting at the start position.

Methods.method_declar: func uppercased() -> String

Methods.method_description: Calls the given closure with a pointer to the contents of the string, represented as a null-terminated sequence of UTF-8 code units.

params.param_description: A closure with a pointer parameter that points to a null-terminated sequence of UTF-8 code units. If body has a return value, that value is also used as the return value for the withCString(_:) method. The pointer argument is valid only for the duration of the method’s execution.

Methods.method_declar: func withCString<Result>(_ body: (UnsafePointer<CChar>) throws -> Result) rethrows -> Result

return_description: The return value, if any, of the body closure parameter.

Methods.method_description: Calls the given closure with a pointer to the contents of the string, represented as a null-terminated sequence of code units.

params.param_description: The encoding in which the code units should be interpreted.

A closure with a pointer parameter that points to a null-terminated sequence of code units. If body has a return value, that value is also used as the return value for the withCString(encodedAs:_:) method. The pointer argument is valid only for the duration of the method’s execution.

Methods.method_declar: func withCString<Result, TargetEncoding>(encodedAs targetEncoding: TargetEncoding.Type, _ body: (UnsafePointer<TargetEncoding.CodeUnit>) throws -> Result) rethrows -> Result where TargetEncoding : _UnicodeEncoding

return_description: The return value, if any, of the body closure parameter.

Methods.method_declar: mutating func write(_ other: String)
func write<Target>(to target: inout Target) where Target : TextOutputStream

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are not equal.

params.param_description: A value to compare.
Another value to compare.

Methods.method_declar: static func != (lhs: Substring, rhs: Substring) -> Bool
static func != <RHS>(lhs: Substring, rhs: RHS) -> Bool where RHS : StringProtocol

Methods.method_description: Creates a new collection by concatenating the elements of a sequence and a collection.

params.param_description: A collection or finite sequence.
A range-replaceable collection.

Methods.method_declar: static func + <Other>(lhs: Other, rhs: Substring) -> Substring where Other : Sequence, Self.Element == Other.Element

Methods.method_description: Creates a new collection by concatenating the elements of a collection and a sequence.

params.param_description: A range-replaceable collection.
A collection or finite sequence.

Methods.method_declar: static func + <Other>(lhs: Substring, rhs: Other) -> Substring where Other : Sequence, Self.Element == Other.Element

Methods.method_description: Creates a new collection by concatenating the elements of two collections.

params.param_description: A range-replaceable collection.
Another range-replaceable collection.

Methods.method_declar: static func + <Other>(lhs: Substring, rhs: Other) -> Substring where Other : RangeReplaceableCollection, Self.Element == Other.Element

Methods.method_description: Appends the elements of a sequence to a range-replaceable collection.

params.param_description: The array to append to.
A collection or finite sequence.

Methods.method_declar: static func += <Other>(lhs: inout Substring, rhs: Other) where Other : Sequence, Self.Element == Other.Element

Methods.method_description: Returns a partial range extending upward from a lower bound.

params.param_description: The lower bound for the range.

Methods.method_declar: postfix static func ... (minimum: Substring) -> PartialRangeFrom<Substring>

Methods.method_description: Returns a partial range up to, and including, its upper bound.

params.param_description: The upper bound for the range.

Methods.method_declar: prefix static func ... (maximum: Substring) -> PartialRangeThrough<Substring>

Methods.method_description: Returns a closed range that contains both of its bounds.

params.param_description: The lower bound for the range.
The upper bound for the range.

Methods.method_declar: static func ... (minimum: Substring, maximum: Substring) -> ClosedRange<Substring>

Methods.method_description: Returns a partial range up to, but not including, its upper bound.

params.param_description: The upper bound for the range.

Methods.method_declar: prefix static func ..< (maximum: Substring) -> PartialRangeUpTo<Substring>

Methods.method_description: Returns a half-open range that contains its lower bound but not its upper bound.

params.param_description: The lower bound for the range.
The upper bound for the range.

Methods.method_declar: static func ..< (minimum: Substring, maximum: Substring) -> Range<Substring>

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is less than that of the second argument.

params.param_description: A value to compare.
Another value to compare.

Methods.method_declar: static func < <RHS>(lhs: Substring, rhs: RHS) -> Bool where RHS : StringProtocol

params.param_description: A value to compare.
Another value to compare.

Methods.method_declar: static func <= (lhs: Substring, rhs: Substring) -> Bool

params.param_description: A value to compare.
Another value to compare.

Methods.method_declar: static func <= <RHS>(lhs: Substring, rhs: RHS) -> Bool where RHS : StringProtocol

params.param_description: A value to compare.
Another value to compare.

Methods.method_declar: static func == <RHS>(lhs: Substring, rhs: RHS) -> Bool where RHS : StringProtocol

Another value to compare.

Another value to compare.

params.param_description: A value to compare.
Another value to compare.

Vars.var_description: The number of elements in the collection.
The first element of the collection.
The indices that are valid for subscripting the collection, in ascending order.
A Boolean value indicating whether the collection is empty.
The last element of the collection.
A sequence containing the same elements as this sequence, but on which some operations, such as map and filter, are implemented lazily.
A value less than or equal to the number of elements in the collection.
A value less than or equal to the number of elements in the collection.
